Parameters:path – path to the csv file
Returns:df
ds_project.model.customer_validation.is_existing_customer(device_id: str, customer_hist: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → bool¶

Lookup if device_id is present in customer history data

Parameters:
  • device_id – identifyer of an individual customer
  • customer_hist – DataFrame of individual customer purchase history
Returns:

True if device_id is in DataFrame, else False
ds_project.model.customer_validation.is_fraudulent_customer(device_id: str, is_existing_cust: bool, customer_hist: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → bool¶

Lookup if a fraudulent transaction is found in customer history

Parameters:
  • device_id – identifier of an individual customer
  • is_existing_cust – True if customer has purchase history
  • customer_hist – DataFrame of individual customer purchase history
Returns:

True if device_id is in DataFrame, else False

ds_project.model.feature_engineering module¶

ds_project.model.feature_engineering.cnt_purchase(device_id: str, is_existing_cust: bool, customer_hist: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → int¶

adding 1 to the number of historic purchases by a customer

Parameters:
  • device_id – identifier of an individual customer
  • is_existing_cust – True if customer has purchase history
  • customer_hist – DataFrame of individual customer purchase history
Returns:

cnt of puchases by customer
ds_project.model.feature_engineering.sec_since_last_purchase(device_id: str, dt_purchase: datetime.datetime, is_existing_cust: bool, customer_hist: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → int¶

derives the time elapsed since the last purchase of a customer

Parameters:
  • device_id – identifier of an individual customer
  • dt_purchase – timestamp of purchase for specific transaction
  • is_existing_cust – True if customer has purchase history
  • customer_hist – DataFrame of individual customer purchase history
Returns:

time elapsed in seconds
ds_project.model.feature_engineering.sec_since_signup(dt_signup: datetime.datetime, dt_purchase: datetime.datetime) → int¶

derives the time elapsed between signup and purchase for current transaction

Parameters:
  • dt_signup – timestamp of signup for specific transaction
  • dt_purchase – timestamp of purchase for specific transaction
Returns:

time elapsed in seconds

Tests for consistency of timestamps of a transaction :param dt_signup: timestamp of signup for specific transaction :param dt_purchase: timestamp of purchase for specific transaction :return: True if timestamps are consistent, else False

ds_project.model.input_validation.is_valid_input(raw_data: dict) → bool¶

Evaluates raw transaction data

Parameters:raw_data – dictionary of transation data of a single purchase

ds_project.model.training module¶

ds_project.model.training.apply_ohe(ohe, df, cols)¶

applies pretrained OneHotEncoder to defined columns of a DataFrame

Parameters:
  • ohe – pretrained OneHotEncoder
  • df – DataFrame, equivalent to the df that ohe was trained on
  • cols – Columns, equivalent to the df that ohe was trained on
Returns:

onehotencoded dataframe
ds_project.model.training.apply_scaler(scaler, df, cols)¶

applies pretrained Scaler to defined columns of a DataFrame

Parameters:
  • scaler – pretrained Scaler
  • df – DataFrame, equivalent to the df that scaler was trained on
  • cols – Columns, equivalent to the df that scaler was trained on
Returns:

scaled dataframe
